name: Slice
author: Nipype (interface)
description:
Slice, as implemented in Nipype (module: nipype.interfaces.fsl, interface: Slice).

Use fslslice to split a 3D file into lots of 2D files (along z-axis).


    Examples
    --------

    >>> from nipype.interfaces.fsl import Slice
    >>> slice = Slice()
    >>> slice.inputs.in_file = 'functional.nii'
    >>> slice.inputs.out_base_name = 'sl'
    >>> slice.cmdline
    'fslslice functional.nii sl'

inputs.name: Args
inputs.description: A string. Additional parameters to the command.

inputs.name: Environ
inputs.description: A dictionary with keys which are a bytes or none or a value of class 'str' and with values which are a bytes or none or a value of class 'str'. Environment variables.

inputs.name: In file
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Input filename.

inputs.name: Output type
inputs.description: 'nifti' or 'nifti_pair' or 'nifti_gz' or 'nifti_pair_gz'. Fsl output type.

output-files.name: Out files
output-files.description: A list of items which are a pathlike object or string representing an existing file. No description provided.
